means: 命运
厄运
死亡
（尤指不利的、有罪的）判决，宣判
注定
判定
使…的失败
宣判
波林杆菌芽胞；毁灭战士

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"命运，运气"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: destiny, fate, lot, doom, luck, fortune
means: destiny ： 普通用词，侧重预先注定的命运，对未来命运的美好憧憬。
fate ： 较庄严用词，多指不幸的命运，暗示不可避免，令人畏惧和人的意志无法改变，宿命论色彩较浓。
lot ： 多指偶然的运气或终身遭受的不幸命运。
doom ： 指最终的，常常是灾难性或毁灭性的命运，隐含不可避免的意味。
luck ： 普通日常用词，指好的或坏的运气，尤多指好运气，有时也指成功或愉快的结局。
fortune ： 普通用词，指由机会或运气来决定的一种命运，如暗示一种比fate好的运气或一种愉快的未来。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"判决，宣判"之意。
means: sentence ： 法律用词，指根据罪犯所犯罪行的轻重而宣判处罚。
condemn ： 普通用词，指法院对审理结束的案件做出的定罪判刑。
judge ： 指对案件作出审理判决，但判决内容较笼统，不如sentence和condemn使用广泛。
convict ： 法律用词，指审判后判定有罪，但未作最后判决。
doom ： 书面用词，指郑重他宣判某人有罪。

sentence.Network_en: Why are people so full of gloom and doom?
sentence.Network_cn: 为什么人们如此沮丧悲观？

sentence.Network_en: A sense of impending doom came upon all of us.

sentence.Network_en: A sense of imminent doom was inescapable.
sentence.Network_cn: 一种即将来临的毁灭感无可逃避。

jx.jx_en_mean: (亦作 gloom and doom)a general feeling of pessimism or despondency

lj.lj_ly: the national feeling of doom and gloom.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English dōm 'statute, judgement', of Germanic origin, from a base meaning 'to put in place'; related to do

encyclopedia.content: 一本关于游戏DOOM两位作者以及DOOM游戏从鼎盛到衰落的历史教科书。 电子游戏已成为信息时代的日常娱乐，而它背后的文化和历史却鲜为人知。本书是第一部游戏领域的传记文学，它忠实详尽地讲述了两位玩家是如何走上游戏之路，如何制作出迄今为止影响力最大的游戏作品——Doom和Quake，以及他们为何在最辉煌的时候分道扬镳。与所有传记文学一样，不同的读者能从中得到不同体验：游戏制作的背景内幕，光环之中的趣闻轶事，年少创业的

entry.def: Doom is a terrible future state or event which you cannot prevent.

example.tran: 他关于大难临头的警告

example.ex: ...a wicked mermaid who lured sailors to their doom.
example.tran: 引诱水手走向灭亡的邪恶的美人鱼

entry.def: If you have a sense or feeling of doom, you feel that things are going very badly and are likely to get even worse.

example.ex: Why are people so full of gloom and doom?...
example.tran: 为什么人们如此沮丧悲观？

example.ex: Attendance figures had been steadily dropping, creating a mood of doom and discouragement among theatre directors.
example.tran: 上座人数一直持续下降，使得戏剧导演产生悲观泄气的情绪。

entry.def: If a fact or event dooms someone or something to a particular fate, it makes certain that they are going to suffer in some way.

example.ex: That argument doomed their marriage to failure.
example.tran: 那次争吵使他们的婚姻注定要失败。

sentences.sentence: "everyone was aware of the approaching doom but was helpless to avoid it"
"that's unfortunate but it isn't the end of the world"
"She was destined to become a great pianist"

means.word_mean: 2. pronounce a sentence on (somebody) in a court of law;

sentences.sentence: "He was condemned to ten years in prison"

means.word_mean: 3. make certain of the failure or destruction of;

sentences.sentence: "This decision will doom me to lose my position"

Sentence.sentence: Does this spell the doom of the physical book?
When the Commerce Department reported last week that the trade deficit in June approached $50 billion, it set off a new round of economic doom saying

sentences.cn: 坏天气注定了庄稼要歉收。

means.word_mean: 使…的失败(或灭亡、毁灭、坏结局)成为必然

sentences.en: They are doomed to make the same mistakes in the future.
sentences.cn: 他们将来注定要犯同样的错误。

means.word_mean: 宣判，判决，判定，判(某人)刑(to)

sentences.en: The court doomed the accused to a long term of imprisonment.
sentences.cn: 法庭判处被告长期监禁。

sentences.en: The report on our economic situation is full of doom and gloom.
sentences.cn: 这份关于我们经济状况的报告充满了令人绝望和沮丧的调子。

jushi.chinese: 坏天气注定了庄稼要歉收。

jushi.english: The plan was doomed by their refusal to give it any financial support.
jushi.chinese: 由于他们拒绝给予任何资助,该计划注定要失败。
这一行动注定他的努力要失败。
